text: I recently reactivated my membership with the off-peak package at Pure Gym Enfield, enticed by its affordable price of £22. However, my experience has been far from satisfactory.  The main issue with the off-peak package is that it restricts users to access the gym only after 21:00. This limitation has resulted in overcrowding during the available hours, making it incredibly challenging to find any space, machines, or free weights to use. It defeats the purpose of a gym membership if you cannot utilise the facilities due to excessive demand.  Pure Gym Enfield offers a solution to this problem by providing an upgrade option for an additional £7, allowing subscribers to access the facilities at any time. However, this feels like an unnecessary expense to overcome the gym's own overcrowding issue.  Furthermore, I found the standards at the gym to be disappointing. The ventilation system appears to be inadequate, especially when the air conditioning is not in operation. Poor ventilation poses a potential health and safety risk, particularly during intense workout sessions when fresh airflow is crucial.  Overall, my experience at Pure Gym Enfield has been unsatisfactory. The overcrowding issue during off-peak hours, coupled with the need to pay extra for a better workout experience, has left me disappointed. The subpar ventilation system further exacerbates the problems and raises concerns about the gym's commitment to its members' well-being.  I hope that Pure Gym Enfield takes these issues into consideration and makes the necessary improvements to provide a better experience for its members.

text: My experience with the gym's personal trainer was nothing short of disappointing and uncomfortable. My friends(totally beginners) and I were in the middle of our workout, doing a superset, when the trainer approached us. He inquired about the number of sets remaining with the dumbbells. We informed him that we still had a considerable number of sets left to complete. He then suggested using heavier dumbbells, but unfortunately, there were no other suitable options available. He mockingly suggested that we should try using lighter weights upstairs. This condescending and belittling remark left us feeling humiliated and judged.  It's disheartening to encounter such unprofessional behavior from a personal trainer who should be motivating and inspiring clients to push themselves, not ridiculing them for their chosen weights. Making us feel inadequate and uncomfortable in the gym environment is completely unacceptable.  To make matters worse, he and his client continued to talk and stare at us, adding to the sense of being the center of unwanted attention. It was as if he was more interested in gossiping about us than actually focusing on his own client's workout.  This kind of behavior reflects poorly on the gym and its staff. As paying members, we should be treated with respect and encouragement, not subjected to mockery and discomfort. I sincerely hope the gym takes this feedback seriously and addresses the issue promptly to ensure a more supportive and inclusive environment for all its members.  Despite the unfortunate encounter with the rude gym staff, I must acknowledge that the gym itself offers a comprehensive range of equipment and facilities. However, it is imperative for the management to address and rectify such instances of unprofessional behavior to maintain a positive and inclusive environment for all members. I sincerely hope that my feedback will contribute to the improvement of overall customer satisfaction and service quality at the gym.

I will be in a Teal top, and I'll be there a little early to meet you when you arrive.”  I arrived a bit early at 1545 to use the toilets. I quite clearly looked lost trying to find the toilets because I hadn’t been here before. No member of staff approached me to ask if I was ok.   I found the toilets and then returned to the foyer/entrance to the gym “outside the pods”. I was there about 1550. By 1600, nobody in a teal top was anywhere to be seen. UPDATE IN RESPONSE TO PURE GYMS REPLY:  There is sufficient detail including my name, date, time and location for you to be able to deal with the issue from here. You’ll see me on the CCTV. text: The gym itself is okay, could benefit from an extra leg machine (e.g.: hack squat) and a better calf raise machine (e.g.: standing straight leg). Lockers are only outside changing rooms which was annoying at the start but I got used to it after a couple of months.  The biggest issue I have with this gym is the fact that most of the equipment ALWAYS has plates on it. Most people do not bother putting weights back. I have been to a large number of other gyms in Norwich (including other Puregym in Castle Mall), other cities and countries, and I've never seen it that bad. The culture in this gym is really poor, and the management needs to do something about it, there are ways to encourage/remind of positive and responsible behaviour. As of now, a lot of people have zero respect for the place, the equipment, and the people who will be using said equipment after they're done. Imagine your young sister or (grand)mother joining the gym and not being able to use half of the machines because they got 20/25kg plates all over which they cannot remove themselves safely. Really, really poor.

text: My housemate (F) and I (M) are looking for a gym together (for the classes). Looking to trial a few classes.  We both wrote to member services asking for a trial. She was offered a free 3 day pass. I was told they don’t do trials and to purchase a membership.   I wrote back with a screenshot of the divergent responses and was told that the difference in treatment is because she either is or was a member, and I was not.   My housemate has in fact never been a member of Puregym, she is only joining because I am. I have been a member for years so I pointed out my membership details and the same ‘membership’ based trial is now not on the table for myself. text: I recently joined up with PureGym in Basildon and was told on their website that there is 2 hours of free parking in Carpark 6, Eastgate Shopping centre.   Under the information on how to access the 2 hours free parking on their website, it states that you need to take a yellow token at the entrance upon arrival and then validate the token to activate the free 2 hour parking.   On my first day to the gym I noticed that there was no yellow token to be had from the machine and the barrier at the entrance was up, so I continued to park my vehicle.  Once I got inside the gym there was absolutely NO information regarding validating your vehicles parking, to avoid being fined!!    I continued to do my workout, none the wiser, believing that I was automatically receiving free parking, being as there were no yellow tokens anymore. Absolutely no one told me anything, as far as i knew there was a new system in place.    It's now been 2 weeks since I first joined PureGym and I have been issued with 2 fines for not paying for my parking at Car park 6 (Eastgate shopping centre) I cannot believe that this has happened, I have been to the gym a total of 7 times since joining in February 2024, meaning that I will be receiving another 5 fines totaling £420. This is money that I can't afford lose.   I was unaware of there being another method of validating your vehicle as I was not notified by PureGym.  PureGym seriously need to update their website regarding the new parking rules as this has now cost me hundreds of pounds in parking fines.   Might I point out that PureGym have also had a similar issue with people being issued multiple fines due to insufficient information, at the their branch in Billericay in 2021.   Update 11/3/2024 PureGym have now updated their website with the correct information on how to validate your parking. This was done today. Thanks PureGym, had you done that to begin with I I would not have £420 in fines to pay!

text: I’d been with PureGym for 5 years and this branch steered me clear of the brand for good. The gym’s culture from the bottom to the top is rotten and it really shows every time you visit. From weights not tidied away to “which piece of equipment will be broken ,and take several weeks to be repaired or replaced this time?”. Members often don’t return weights or equipment to the correct place, leaving you to go searching or clean up after them. This lack of regard is mirrored by staff and management, who do nothing to combat this culture and when issues are raised, offer nothing but empty promises. The last time I visited the AC wasn’t even on in the area I was training in and of course a piece of equipment had developed a fault! The gym also suffers from overcrowding due to its limited size and available equipment. I would suggest avoiding this gym unless you would like and underwhelming, unreliable and unbearable experience. P.s. take a look at the images I snapped before leaving for the final time.

text: Was looking to change from my regular pure gym to this branch. Unfortunately I had a shockingly horrible experience with the male tall trainer that works here. He is extremely aggressive and rude. The first day I attended he consistently stared at me whilst training another person. The next day I approached him to ask for help on adjusting the leg extension machine as he was the only staff member on the floor. He acted very weirdly and told me that he didn’t understand my problem and that the equipment I use at my usual gym isn’t “real gym equipment” (even though it is another Pure Gym). He aggressively spoke over me and when I asked that he let me talk, he rudely demanded “Speak then” and stormed away from me. He obviously has some serious issues and has problems with speaking to women. After the encounter I went to the women’s changing rooms and was shocked about the experience. Another female regular gym goer approached me and told that he is consistently rude to women - he had laughed at a girl who was struggling to keep up in his spin class. I can see that she has also left a review and said that his name is Fares Mahieddine. When I asked this trainer to show me where the manager was, he pointed to the managers door then shouted across the gym “you’re welcome” at me. The manager said that he would contact me about my experience but didn’t. They clearly don’t care about this staff member making women uncomfortable. Overall the gym is fine, there is a good variety of equipment. But I wouldn’t go back again based on the abusive staff member and the carelessness of the manager. If you are a woman, I would stay far away from here and go to the Limehouse or Bow wharf branch instead. As for the trainer, maybe he should look into anger management sessions to control his attitude towards women. Or find another job that doesn’t involve people asking for advice on gym equipment … aka a basic role of a gym trainer.

text:
I visited the gym today and encountered an infuriating situation that left me fuming. Despite the crowded atmosphere, a personal trainer shamelessly occupied a bench and a smith machine for a whopping half an hour, all while nobody else was actually using them. To make matters worse, he went to great lengths to safeguard the equipment, placing his diary and personal phone on the floor as if marking his territory. This behaviour is absolutely disgraceful, especially considering the gym's explicit policy of encouraging equipment sharing. Even more astonishing, when approached by several individuals who politely requested to use the machines since they were unoccupied, his response was filled with sheer arrogance and selfishness. It's truly exasperating to witness such actions, particularly because we're all paying to use the facilities, and it's only fair that everyone has equal access to the equipment. This is not an isolated incident, as I have observed other PT's engaging in similar behaviour. It's disheartening to see the blatant disregard for basic gym etiquette, all for the sake of reserving equipment for a trainee who isn't even present.

I understand that personal trainers earn their living by training others, but it's important to remember that we are all paying to use the facilities. It's only fair that everyone has equal access to the equipment. While I appreciate the role of personal trainers in the gym, it becomes a problem when they monopolise machines and benches for extended periods, especially when there are no clients actively utilising them. The gym's policy of encouraging equipment sharing is in place precisely to ensure fairness and efficiency for all members. We should strive for a balance where personal trainers can fulfill their professional duties while still respecting the needs and rights of other gym-goers. It's disheartening to witness instances where this balance is disregarded, leading to frustration and a sense of unfairness among paying members.

text: Normally, I never leave a negative review as I don't like to be a Karen. However, I believe I should raise the concerns I have with the facility in order for it to be rectified. I've been a member of another gym for 10 years can't fault it apart from its not 24 hours and no longer accommodates my life style. I have been to several other gyms along side my original gym membership to find the one that will suit me. I will cancel my other membership once I'm happy I've found the gym for me.  Out of all the gyms I've tried all of which are your competitors, I have to say your gym comes out on top and I'm keen to make the move to your gym permanent as long as these issues are looked into.  Now I can cope with the fact the air con isn't cold enough and it's hot in your gym. Breaking a sweat in a gym is the aim anyway so I can live with that.  I love the big competition squat rack and weight plates. The only issue I have is the fact I have always trained on my own. Never bothered with a gym partner as gym time is my time. This means I have to watch my own form and correct myself when my lift isn't going to plan. I have always been fine with solo training and always managed to lift correctly and safely. This is only been possible with the use of a large mirror like you already have in certain locations. I carry out big compound lifts on your squat racks and would feel much better with the use of a mirror.  Now the reason why I have given a two star rating is down to the fact I love your gym and facility and it suits my needs perfectly apart from the issues listed above. Now I can just about deal with everything I've mentioned so far. Now what I can't cope with and I can't stress this enough is the lack of cleanliness in the male changing rooms.  I have been a member of your gym since the 7th of June and from day one the hand dryer is out of order. That's not an issue things break, but at least provide an alternative way of drying your hands while the hand dryer is out of use. Not really a fan of trying to lift weights with moist hands.  The dryer is not my major cleanliness concern. The fact that since the 7th of June you have had a blood stain on the wall of the cubical is unacceptable. I know its a blood stain as it was all over the toilet on the 7th when I went to use the facility and has since been cleaned off everywhere but the wall. We are now on the 29th of June. We have had a blood stained wall for 23 days. I am aware the gym is not always manned by staff, but id like to think something as like that would be addressed on the day it happened. This is not only disgusting but a health hazard to others since its directly below the toilet paper dispenser.   I have taken photos of the facility with blood stain and dates the photos were taken circled. Unfortunately I can’t upload with this review but will happily send them to who ever requires them. I hope as a company you take this as positive feedback to improve on, and will look into some of these issues for the benefit of me and other members. At a minimum id expect the blood to be cleaned and a toilet cleanliness rota put in place. I apologise for being a Karen as it’s not normally my nature how ever as a company I believe feedback is important. I will send a copy of this via email also to ensure it gets to who it needs to.  Thank you  Mac (The Karen)

text: The noise in this gym is absolutely atrocious! The managers/owners don't seem to realise that there may be people in the gym with hyperacusis, misophonia or other types of sensitivity to sound - and that we want to workout in relative peace and quiet! The background music is fine and when the classes aren't on there isn't a problem, but the classes blast trashy club music at full volume and then the instructor has to shout over the microphone to make themselves heard. I wear noise cancelling headphones and listen to my own music while I'm working out, but I can still hear their noise. Today I had to leave five minutes into my warm-up because there were two classes happening at the same time, so there were two sets of music blaring and two voices screeching over the mic, it was just horrible. I pay my membership just like everybody else and deserve to be able to work-out in a comfortable environment.  I wrote an email and complained about this a few weeks ago and got no reply, so I'm going to find another gym.

text: I literally posted a good survey on this gym a mere few days ago about my experience at this gym for a month.  I'm changing that now due to an experience with a judgmental staff member at the gym. I was on the hamstring curl machine, where on my last 4th set, he comes over, starts to question me during mid set saying I'm slamming the weights down.   This is silly because I wasn't slamming the weights down... He said I'd break it in this fashion.. Why does the machine go up to 100kg, and why does he think the concentric pulling of the machine would break it? It was 45kg on the last set, instead of 59kg for the other 3x sets...  It was utterly ridiculous and he wouldn't target other staff gym members who quite literally slammed their weights down on the eccentric portion. What I find bizarre is that he doesn't own the equipment and if he's going to take the duty of protecting the equipment very seriously, he better start going to every gym member doing this, but he doesn't. text:
Do not join this gym if you’re a woman. I have been to plenty of gyms over the years and have never felt more uncomfortable in my life! The male members here will literally move equipment to get a better view to sit and stare at you while you’re working out. I’ve seen men holding their phones up as if slyly recording and when you check the direction of their phone it will be pointing towards a woman. It’s disgusting.

The gym is also filthy! There are no stations to clean down equipment. People leave the treadmills and machines covered in sweat and you can’t even wipe it down if you wanted to. There’s always rubbish left in the machines and floor, spilt drinks etc.

Clips for the cable machines are always missing. The attachments are never put away and are scattered on the floor (this is OK but you’re not allowed a gym bag on the floor next to you; make that make sense). Even if they were put away, half of the most needed attachments are missing so good luck finding what you want. You need to share 1 straight bar between the whole gym.

I’ve been here almost a year and it’s just getting worse. If you need a gym the same price that’s clean, professional and you don’t get gawked at, join JD Gym! There’s even a women’s only section unlike at pure.

text:
I’ve had a membership with Puregym for 5 years and the Angel branch has the rudest staff I’ve ever dealt with.
A few months ago a male PT came up to me and just said that my squats were bad without offering constructive feedback on how to improve my form.

And this week I was doing powerlifting and a new member of staff came up to me and told me off for having my shoes off to do my deadlifts.
Never once have I been told at a puregym I have to keep shoes on, I’ve even been advised to take them off by other PTs for those lifts. Anyone who knows a thing about weightlifting knows that decreasing the space between your feet and the floor is the safest and best way for squats and deadlifts.

After I explained to her how unsafe and risky it would be to do my lifts with my chunky shoes on she said she didn’t care and that in this gym shoes stay on. She said it was a hygiene issue, but I don’t see her enforcing rules and bothering customers about wiping down surfaces. I’ve seen people in their socks plenty of times in that gym and she told me I was lying, even though she told me herself she’d been there for only 6 weeks and I’ve been coming to Angel puregym for over a year.

I didn’t want to injure myself so I continued and she continuously disrupted my workout to speak to me in a condescending way as if I was a child.

The staff clearly don’t know their stuff and it seems like they just look for ways to make your time there unpleasant out of boredom or just enjoying having power.

text:
I couldn't agree more with the sentiments expressed in the previous review regarding the bike rack at our local gym.

As a regular gym-goer and an advocate for sustainable transportation, I was excited to see that my local gym had a bike rack. However, my recent experience using this bike rack has left me thoroughly frustrated, especially as the rainy season is approaching.

One of the most glaring issues is the complete lack of rain protection for the bike rack. Living in a region with unpredictable weather, it's astonishing that the gym hasn't invested in a simple shelter or covering for the bike rack. As we all know, rainy days can catch us off guard, and returning to a soaked bicycle after a strenuous workout is far from ideal.

Furthermore, during peak gym hours, the bike rack is consistently full. This overcrowding issue has become a recurring problem, making it incredibly inconvenient for cyclists like myself who rely on biking as a means of transportation to and from the gym. It's frustrating to arrive at the gym, only to find that there is no available space to secure my bike safely.

In order to enhance the overall experience for cyclists, the gym should seriously consider expanding its bike rack capacity. This would not only ensure that cyclists have a reliable place to park their bikes but also encourage more people to choose sustainable transportation options.

In conclusion, while I appreciate the gym's efforts to accommodate cyclists, there are significant improvements that need to be made. Providing rain protection for the bike rack and addressing the issue of overcrowding during peak hours would go a long way in making the gym more cyclist-friendly. Until these improvements are made, I would advise fellow cyclists to explore alternative parking options or be prepared for the inconvenience of dealing with a less-than-ideal bike rack situation at this gym.

text: Today was my first day and really let down. Recently started working in Coventry but home is Sutton Coldfield. Was going for the off peak membership as I wanted to do 6.30am classes before work but as I wanted both gyms had to pay the higher membership, which is fine. I got up at 5am today, got ready, drove to Coventry to do the class I was booked onto. I was then told that as I was the only one booked on he cancelled the class!!! text: I've been a member at this gym for over 3 years now, it was great at the start. Whilst we have seen continual increases in membership prices the quality of the gym experience has drastically plummeted. It's virtually impossible to get in a training session due to how oversubscribed the gym is. I've resorted to only being able to train upstairs with the more basic machines. Even if you are able to get a seat at one of the benches downstairs everything is filthy, equipment and dumbbells are scattered everywhere and the air smells awful and musty. Most of the staff here are fine but there is minimal effort made to keep things organised and clean and much of the equipment is in serious need of repair or replacement. Some members abuse the machines causing them to break and people should have minimal levels of vetting before being able to train here as some of the few ruin it for the most without any consideration, I've seen 2 fights break out in my past 10 visits, once with my partner training with me and it totally spoiled our session hearing a screaming match between two roid heads. The mens changing rooms are absolutely vile, many people have also told me that they have to hold their breath going in there including staff - it smells awful and is not cleaned despite cleaners signing the sheets on display. The urinals are often blocked/overflowing, the two toilets are an absolute biohazard covered in excrement stains and waste and the mirror and sink are always covered in dirt, hair etc... I've attached a couple of pictures of this . I went today and for the first time just left after 5 minutes, there just was no chance of a good session. Amongst the chaos new members were being shown around, all they care about it getting more signups and once your in the quality of your experience is given zero thought. There was recently a Gymshark event here and external managers attended making sure the quality of the gym was high and clean so the capability is more than there, the bathrooms were clean for one day but of course this was not maintained, just a show for one day - this should really be the baseline standard paying members should expect, not just for special one off occasions after which it quickly falls back into a real state. With the upgraded membership you're supposed to get access to one of the two massage beds 10 sessions/month and also the sports water, both of these are often out of order and the membership just feels like a ripoff, especially with the constant sneaky price increases. I'm going to be finding a new gym.

text:
This is a great gym, it's relatively tidy, has good equipment and is well maintained but it's air conditioning is absolutely awful. It’s also incredibly busy, even at 6AM and I wouldn’t dream of going in the evenings until after 8PM.

I will be suspending or cancelling my membership imminently. Today at 9AM it was 26 degrees inside, 2 degrees warmer than outside and 70% humidity at one point.

For me this boarders on dangerously hot to train in with no fans or airflow. For reference their customer services team tell me their gyms are kept between 18 and 21 degrees....

They are aware of the issue and actively looking to address or fix it but I'm not confident anything will actually change.

Last year mobile portable A/C units were introduced as the integrated units from when this used to be a D/W gym are not sufficient to cool the space given the (presumably) metal roof which sits above the ceiling tiles. However I've been told they will not be returning following managements decision to remove them.

It's a shame because I enjoy using their other sites but this is my home gym I use most often. A price increase recently to top it off is just perfect...

- Their response is the same standard spiel they have been parroting for years in all the other reviews below.  There is a fundamental inadequacy with the air conditioning at this gym. Train elsewhere during the summer months.

text:
It’s okay, I’d only workout here if I absolutely had to. I understand the PureGym business model, but you’d hope better in Spinningfields.

Firstly, the gym itself is quite tired. The treadmills and stair masters look ancient, with the buttons barely working. The weight machines and rack are well stocked, but again look tired. They are however clean.

Secondly, the heat. It’s simply way too hot in there. The air con clearly doesn’t work (or if it does, not very well) and instead there’s a few fans dotted about the place, which don’t do much in normal settings, let alone a gym environment.

Worryingly, there are many reviews with similar complaints. More concerning, I think these complaints are ignored due to the sheer volume of people who attend this gym, so the attitude of “if it ain’t broke” is evident.

Let’s hope the staff take notice of these views and make the necessary improvements. It’s a great shame as the gym itself has potential and is in prime location.

text:
SERIOUS PERSONAL SAFETY THREAT.

Do not attend this gym. The issue has required police prosecution.

I was threatened to be stabbed by another member this morning and was appalled by how the staff handled the situation.

The individual continually insulted me, urged me to fight him outside, and threatened to stab me in the changing rooms or outside. Particularly if he ended up losing his membership. The initial trigger was him thinking that I was being condescending towards him.

The on-floor staff - who I was later told have no training in conflict management - refused to address the violent individual, despite him screaming and behaving in a clearly belligerent manner. They only addressed me, and implied that I had contributed to this issue. As witnesses and any footage will show, I was nothing but calm and measured throughout.

Nevertheless, I was asked to leave the situation while the violent individual was allowed to finish his workout and has retained his membership. I must repeat: this was not just a heated argument, but a stabbing threat in London. No one was interested in taking this seriously for me, and they won't do so for you.

The staff also informed me that their CCTV may not reach the respective area of the gym. And that the CCTV may not be available as the internet was down.

I am shocked at how lightly PureGym consider a stabbing threat on their premises. I'm committed to chasing this case down until some consequences are faced.

In the mean time, do not attend this gym. For your own personal safety concerns.

text: The signing up process was quick and simple however the gym itself is massively overpopulated for its size which meant a lack of availability on pretty much everything, I had 3 people throughout my session that asked me if they could jump on with me which I am usually okay with, however for it to happen a 3rd time in one session made me question whether I had made a good decision in choosing this gym, the male changing room was shockingly small as were the lockers, I had to force my bag into it (not ideal if coming straight from work with extra clothes in the bag) I noticed a group of lads walking around with their bags and keeping them nearby while they worked out in the free weight section, there were 6 showers I believe and 1 hairdryer which is also strange given the amount of members I saw in the gym on the day I went but what annoyed me the most about the changing room was that there was no shelf in the shower to place body wash/shampoo so I had to place them on the floor with my locker key which is majorly unhygienic, I have been to several gyms (Total Fitness, David Lloyds, JD Everlast) and they all had shelves in their showers. Also during my session there was a workout class, I understand that this is common in every gym however the music that was being played was unbelievably loud so I had to play my earphones on max volume to cover it. Overall I was quite surprised on how negative the experience was especially on my first session I don't think I will continue my membership past the first month.  Staff were super helpful and approachable, equipment in the gym itself was good.

text: After joining Puregym Stratford when it opened, in January, my partner and I lasted less than four months at this establishment.  This is the most unhygienic gym we have visited; no wipe down stations, no paper towels, and embarrassing standards means equipment is greasy if not wet and wiping your hands on your own towel will literally leave marks after using any equipment.   The male changing rooms constantly smell like urine, and when gents enter the odour wafts out into the main floor. Every time.  The management is incompetent. My partner and I eventually left after being physically threatened infront of a member of staff, who was less than enthused about dealing with the situation. After constant pressure to the ‘Safe Space’ team, he then turned around his story and started blaming us. Apparently, gyms are full of testosterone and hormones, and so it’s perfectly natural that people threaten to wait outside the premises to harm you. Tattooed manager, please get a new line of work.   A separate but related note: I was initially amused by the inclusion of a ‘sharps bin’ in the gents toilets. text:
Targeted by manager!
Targeted by manager!

I just finished three-sets of deadlifts and went to refill my water-bottle.

When I returned to do a fourth set, another gym-member asked if I had finished with the weights and I said yes, so he took them.

I then proceeded to the preacher station and did some curls.

When I turned my back the manager started putting my weights away and I said - ''excuse me, I have not finished with these weights''.

This statement angered him somewhat and his response was to say - "Well I could be cruel and tell you to put the weights you left on the floor away" - weights i'd already given to somebody else!

I then had to re-clip the ez-bar as he skulked off.

When I left the gym, I approached the manager and told him that the other gym member took ownership of the weights and he might want to check his CCTV before wrongly accusing me of leaving the weights lying around.

He completely ignored me and walked off without apologising or saying anything.

To the manger. Your attitude stinks.

Perhaps consider that the revenue generated by PureGym members helps to pay your salary and your co-worker's salary!!!

Due to this experience, I'm canceling my membership and going to another gym.

Disclaimer. I'm a little inconsistent with putting weights away but on this instance, I was not at fault.

Date of experience: 04 August 2023

text:
Equipment 7/10

They're pretty good, over the years more attachments have been added for variety and abundance which has been good, broken machines get repaired relatively quickly and feel smooth and well kept overall. Could have more variety, but generally get the job done.

Activity 3/10

More and more people are signing up It's becoming quite packed throughout the entire day, if you go during peak time 6-10pm goodluck getting anything done as you'll be waiting for a machine for pretty long especially when groups of people are on at a time (weekends are good all day all night)

Amenenties 0/10

Lockers are either broken or permanently reserved. Toilets are just as bad but repairs get done now and then. For reference just about half of the lockers are always taken and if the gym is busy people carry their bags with them.

Staff 5/10

Generally staff are good, spoke to a few and seen them interact with people in a good way. Except for the management, refusal to listen and act on complaints, especially when it comes to lockers.  Especially Tarique, an extremely petty and lazy manager. If you complain about anything persistently he'll go as far as following you on cameras to see what you get up to instead of doing his job. Pretty foul behavior.

Do I recommend it?

If you go off peak, Yes.
If you go during peak, avoid it.

text: For the most part the gym is great, plenty of machines and free weights, quiet if you avoid the obvious peak hours and the staff have always been helpful and pleasant on the occasions I've needed to speak to them. text: After training and working there for 3 years. I’ve concluded that it’s the worst run business when it comes to client care and customer satisfaction.  Equipment is mediocre. Never clean. Never working. It’s either too hot or too cold. Facilities are poor and all round atmosphere is just sad, quiet and bitchy.  I worked there as a full time and self employed coach for 3 years and my experience was mixed for sure. Initially our manager was incredible, kind, respectful and always talking to members.  In my final years I was stuck with a manager who not only brought her personal affairs into work, is disgustingly rude and hires anyone they can find including predators (then defend their actions).  Puregym also charge £650 per month to rent PTs and profit off them. As soon as you become a rent PT, you’re no longer included valued.   Final point. Whilst dealing with my mums 18months long battle to cancer which she sadly lost. I was met with zero compassion, no reduction or discount in rent and snarky comments like “you’ve taken too many holidays” and “bit moody aren’t you”.   This business is a terrible one to enter and a terrible to start any PT career.  JD is next door.

text:
Really bad clientele at this site. Gangs of young men. Regularly there is broken equipment. On Monday night there were 3 cross trainer machines all with the left foot peddle smashed. Obviously deliberate vandalism. Other equipment out of order too. Weight machines jutter due to sted heads overloading the machines with weights stretch the machines belt. The gym is unclean with empty bottles left all over. I’ve never seen any clean the equipment after they use it. Equipment smells and often has sweat residue on it. Only 1 scruffy cleaning station at the top end. No cleaning station near the middle section machines.
No visible staff presence. Clearly needs a strong staff presence to patrol the gym stopping vandalism and enforce cleaning.
Hand soap dispenser in men’s toilets is badly installed so you can’t get your hand under it. Only 1 so no back up if it’s out of soap.
I don’t blame the cleaners or the staff. The site is obviously understaffed. It’s the management who need to ensure a better staff presence and tackle the bad clientele who are vandalising and who don’t clean after themselves.
Such a shame too as the design of gym is really nice and it has a lot of potential. It needs more cleaning stations. A staff/security to start identifying and banning the vandals, and to enforce wiping down machines by other clients.  PureGym need to set appropriate standards of acceptable gym use with the clients because it’s clearly not at the moment.

text: I visited PureGym Great Portland St. this afternoon, which was a really disappointing experience. The aircon was broken again and the whole gym had a nasty decomposing smell. PureGym is good at advising members when showers are not working but fail miserably when the aircon breaks, which is frequently.  The gym is clean and the staff are always very friendly however the lack of good aircon is a real issue.  I have been a member for over 8 years and regularly the members have been promised improved aircon. Late last year we were advised by the lovely staff that the whole aircon system was going to be replaced in Jan 2024 however that is yet to happen. PureGym keeps repairing it in patches, which it is just not good enough. PureGym’s Head Office does not want to spend the money which is a shame because potential new members will not join. text: Pros: - It's a new gym, so everything is new, clean and tidy.  Cons: - Lack a lot of equipment, both for machines and free weights. Nothing for calves, no inclined or declined bench presses, one machine for both abduction and adduction, and more. Also very few cardio equipment. - Not enough lockers, and most of them are taken by people who leave their stuff there. Quite frustrating not having where to leave your stuff safely. - "Changing room" is just a few cubicles (like the fitting rooms of clothes shops) and they are shared between men and women. So are the showers and toilets. Not very comfortable. - Staff, though friendly, wasn't very knowledgeable. I approach one of the ladies to ask for advice on how to replace some exercises from my routine due to the lack of equipment and she just kept repeating "we don't have that machine".  - PRICE!!! If they kept the price at £17, I'd say ok. £25? Too much for what the gym offers. £32??? Big no no.. def not worth the price, no way in hell. Just to compare: The Gym Tottenham High Road (about 4 to 5 times the size, with a price of £25 or so)  So yeah, sorry for being a bit too harsh, but having been to quite a few different gyms in London and being able to compare, this is my honest review. There's certainly room for improvement, though, so if they get more machines, benches, cardio, etc... rethink a bit the price, then perhaps it could be a good gym.  PS: As other reviews stated, there was the issue of the closure after less than two weeks and the lack of communication. But hopefully that's an exception and shouldn't happen again.

text:
I used to enjoy going to this gym. I really did. For over a year, in fact.
That all changed when a nasty Scottish lady started working there. Now I dread going there, and am made to feel apologetic for attending the gym in the last hour before closing time. Well, I work over 50 hours a week and don’t have the time to go there, apart from 9pm, sorry.
Every evening at 9:55pm, the Scottish lady screams at the top of her voice “OK STOP WHAT YOU’RE DOING!! THE GYM IS NOW CLOSED!!! PLEASE MAKE YOUR WAY OUT!!!! THE GYM IS CLOOOOSED!!!!!”
This is very different from everyone else’s approach who works there. The lovely, calm Asian guy goes around to everyone individually and politely says the gym will be closing in 10mins.
Here are some other nice things I have noticed since the Scottish lady started:
-	The music is now switched off 40mins before close. Would it be too much to ask to keep it on until close for YOUR PAYING CUSTOMERS??!
-	The air conditioning is apparently too cold for the Scottish lass, who trundles around the gym wearing a beanie – so it appears it is switched off. Then the Scottish lass has the nerve to complain about the sweaty smell from customers. The other night she audibly discussed this with her colleague, then audibly said “I think it was the guy in the red over there”. Would it be too much to ask to keep the air con on until close for YOUR PAYING CUSTOMERS??!
-	I overheard the Scottish lass saying to a customer that she wants patrons to leave by 10pm, as she ‘only has a chance of doing HER workout between 10-1030pm’. Would it be too much to ask to prioritise the needs of YOUR PAYING CUSTOMERS FIRST??!

text:
Mediocre, grubby, budget gym with AWFUL customer service.

Limited selection of kit, narrow range of classes and too busy for its size every evening. On top of that, it’s poorly maintained and shabby. The floors and kit are always dirty and cooking smells (sometimes even smoke!) from the restaurants below often fill the gym. The changing rooms are usually full of litter and the showers always reek of urine. The PTs are sound if you engage with them at least.

The PureGym app is criminally bad with loads of annoying glitches like turning your music off when you open it and the online ‘members area’ website is an unnavigable endless loop of half answers. There’s no number to ring for any help, just an infuriating chat bot or disinterested/rude ‘customer support’ reps who will eventually email you with some passive aggressive comment. They’re cheaper than most places but treat their customers with borderline disdain and their pricing strategy is filled with Ryanair-like tricks to catch you out.

Cheap and grubby gym from a cheap and grubby company.

text: The gym is totally fine when not too busy (e.g. weekend afternoons or late mornings), but due to its proximity to schools/college, it's often flooded with groups of teenagers who don't respect basic rules like putting the weights back or cleaning equipment after their use. The lack of hygiene of these young gym goers is something that should be addressed by the staff as well. Also, they tend to be glued to certain machines without actually doing anything (they are just chatting, laughing and playing games on their phones). The worst issue however is that many of them are underage (some look 11-12) which is against the gym's own rules (please see membership T&Cs) and they clearly shouldn't be in this space. The workers don't seem to be bothered with this issue, but this is a serious safeguarding problem and may also invalidate the business insurance in case any injury is caused to (or by) these kids. I hope this feedback is taken seriously and some real actions will be taken to observe the gym's own rules by its workers and prevent underage kids from joining/attending the gym.

text: I had previously visited gyms of this network and always been satisfied with their quality. However, after moving to Dunfermline, I had to choose another branch. I want to note that cleanliness and a wide selection of equipment are provided here. Yesterday's incident was disappointing: when attempting to perform a "glute bridge" exercise on the Smith machine, I encountered an unexpected obstacle – the safety catches did not lower low enough. This was a surprise for me, as I had never experienced such difficulties with machines before. I had to rethink my workout plan as I prefer to perform this exercise specifically on the Smith machine. Additionally, attempting leg raises on the cable crossover also proved unsuccessful due to the lack of ankle cuffs. For a long time, I tried to find a staff member to ask a question, but no one was on site. The gym also turned out to be quite cramped and crowded, especially with teenagers who occupy machines in groups and for prolonged periods of time.

text: Went to PureGym Newport - South Wales for a couple of hours on a day pass. Have visited this gym previously a couple of years back. Unfortunately, this is the most filthy and deplorable gym I've ever been to. The changing rooms are absolutely disgusting; firstly it took trying 5 lockers before I found one that could be locked with a standard puregym padlock. The toilets had no toilet paper and the two urinals were inaccessible due to 5 litres of urine that were under them. The sink was dirty as if it hadn't been cleaned in months.   The gym itself was incredibly dirty, the floors were matted in dues and hair. The machines are old, rusting and unsafe. Some of the handles of the machines had human skin stuck to them. There were little cleaning stations if any. No cleaners or gym staff around to mention anything to. I saw bed bugs in the carpet - which I have reported to the council.   The benches in the free weight area were the cheapest and most unsafe benches I've ever come across. When doing dumbbell chest presses I like to feel safe when living 60kg+ above my body, I didn't feel safe on these benches they were almost cushion like in their instability.   I'd once subscribed to puregym on a regular basis in another location. This visit to Newport puregym has seen to it that I'll never subscribe nor attend another puregym ever.

text:
This is a pretty poor and uncomfortable gym.

The air con has been broken for a long time and the place will be a sauna for days if there’s any warm weather. If you’re lucky, they open one fire exit and you get a breeze if you stand within 5 metres of it.

On the plus side, weights are not quite as nightmarishly misplaced and scattered around the gym as they used to be (bare minimum of a gym really), and classes don’t blast their music like some other puregyms.

If you drive to the gym and ACC hasn’t closed every road in the city yet, I strongly recommend Results Gym on south college street.

And to add: on visiting Rubislaw puregym, that is a far better gym!

text: Extremely hot, extremely busy and extremely annoying.  I will preface this by saying that I only have positive experiences with the staff there. Nothing against them. I would give the staff 5 stars. Cameron, in particular, is an asset to the gym.  The place is like a Cambodian jungle with the heat and humidity.  The brand new barbells and dumbbells have little to no knurling on them. Quite dangerous, actually, when performing bench press and associated lifts in which a slip would be very bad news.  The gym gets so busy. Not just a little busier at peak hours, it is unusable at peak hours. ~100 people in there officially. Not to mention those unaccounted for, who enter the gym without a membership at the same time as their friends.  I've never been on a morning but on a weeknight, during the hours of 16:00-21:00, the gym is unusable. Forget following an exercise routine. There's no chance.  Equipment selection and utilisation of floor space is extremely poor. One flat bench press to serve the entire gym. Not enough weight benches to serve the free weights section. Flat bench and decline bench pushed right up against each other, preventing spotters from easily accessing them.   Truthfully, they need a bigger facility, but more importantly than this is that they utilise the space that they do have effectively. The space upstairs is extremely poorly utilised. Additionally, they should look to expand the entire upstairs and make it as large as the lower floor.  Don't waste your time joining this gym. I have been attending gyms regularly for almost one decade now. Never have I ever been so inconsistent with my routines. The gym does not permit it. I was a member for one month and have cancelled my membership. There have been many occasions where I turn up to the gym, only to walk straight out of the door.  PureGym Consett is a victim of it's own success. It is supposed to be a budget gym, but with the cheapest membership at £22, the price certainly does not make up for the inconvenience. You couldn't pay me to use this gym.

text:
Posting a review because the gym has been borderline unusable since the start of January, for week days between 4-9 in the evening. Of course there's the new years increase, but this is not helped by all the discounts they advertise for new people. I clocked 201 people on the app yesterday, and the gym is not big at all. They also say that it is 16+, but this is not checked, with many teenagers as low as 12 in there.

The staff/PTs are all nice and helpful, and the gym itself is kept clean.

However, I'm begging for some improvements. Mirrors in front of the squat racks, and by the deadlift zone. Also, mirrors for the whole of the bench section. Another bench for bar chest press. Another two sided cable machine. These could take the place of some cardio machines, or some of the less popular machines upstairs (oblique twist, or the one that works your lower back).

If there's even more budget, a shoulder shrug machine wouldn't go amiss, and another leg press machine.

This gym is in such a good location for me, so I'm rooting for it to get better.

The automatic Puregym reply is to approach the Gym Manager or use the feedback box. Only Pts are ever there, and the feedback box does not exist. Also impossible to suggest things, as they do not reply to the Wrexham email.

text:
Don't quite know where to start.  Overall the space has potential to be great however..... the entrance is vile.  Sadly, lots of our homeless community gain access and sleep here.  The smell and mess is awful.
Then if you want to use the lift you will receive an email telling you that your membership does not cover the easy access option and has to be added to your membership by a manager, so not very inclusive or accessible.
The gym itself is filthy, in particular the changing room.  A new cleaner has been on site who is fantastic when she is there, but not there enough.  Hair, rubbish and makeup always on floor and dressing area, despite a check form being filled in by staff. The hairdryers are a hazard, all melted and broken.  The showers are filthy and cold.  The lockers are in terrible condition.  Its a ridiculous waste of time trying to find one that works.  This review will very probably prompt a generic response from management thanking me for my feedback like the many many other reviews,  however nothing alters.  I really don't like leaving bad reviews as I always try to find a positive but sadly in PureGym Liverpool Central, that is very difficult.  I am going to hang on to my membership for a little while to see if any changes are implemented as, like I initially said, it has the potential to be great but will not do that for too long.  During covid, the club was amazing but standards since have plummeted.   Got to lie at management's doorstep if changes are going to happen.  Fingers crossed 🤞

text: I'm leaving this review because it has now been the second time where a PT has said something directly fatphobic at this gym. Baring in mind I have been to many gyms during my weight loss journey around the UK and abroad and never experienced this. Many overweight people comfort eat due to mental health, and passive aggressive and condescending comments by PTs can be the reason for someone not returning to the gym! My first ever class here in September, a PT ended the ab class by saying to me with a big smile on her face and in front of the whole class, "don't go to McDonald's and KFC!", Whether she was trying to be funny or embarrass and shame me in front of the class, I'm not sure, but regardless it was totally unnecessary and rude. Then the other night after a class, the gym was distributing free baked goods, when I asked the PT what the baked items were, he replied with "oh it's nothing sweet", and he walked off, baring in mind I made no mention of sweet things in my question. Unfortunately I've already paid for a years membership here, so I will have to continue coming to this gym. This is such a shame because at the same time there have been some very supportive and lovely PTs. But I urge the management of this gym to remind certain PT's of common decency and respect!!

text:
This place is ridiculous. I've been a member for a year, since last summer. When I first joined, I noticed that the air conditioning didn't work upstairs, in most of the gym (downstairs is no problem). They finally rolled out some big fans which supposedly cool but don't. I also noticed the bathroom absolutely reeks of stale piss. I put in a complaint and was told the air con was a "complex problem" but was being worked on and that the drainage in the bathroom would be fixed.

Well, we're a year later, and there are no improvements in either. Really...is the air con such a new technology and so complex in 2023 that you can't fix it in a whole year?

I wonder if Puregym would mind a visit from the Health authorities?

On the positive side, the staff is nice and helpful, and they gym, while small, is pretty well equipped.

text: Being used to the excellent facilities at the Pure Gym in Portishead, I moved my membership immediately after moving. However upon my first session I found the gym is oversubscribed, and in the evening is absolute chaos with queues for equipment and weights being left everywhere. It feels like there is much less staff than in Portishead, or at least there is no one enforcing the rules or tidying. The gym has poor ventilation and you really notice the smell on entering. The Yanga water machine doesn’t work most of the time, and the water pressure for the normal taps is inconsistent. There is a good range of equipment and some duplicates, but much of it needs maintenance and I've had to swap exercises due to rust and inconsistent resistance. However, the location is very convenient, changing rooms are clean, and the spin room has a great view. I feel very torn on whether or not to continue.

text:
*LITERALLY just got kicked out of the functional area by a PT because of a group class*

I recently experienced (1 hour ago) a challenging situation at the gym which compelled me to share my feedback. As someone who greatly appreciates utilizing the functional area, particularly for exercises involving kettlebells, box jumps, the assault bike, and the sledge, I encountered an unfortunate incident during my workout.

During my session, a group class was being conducted by a personal trainer, and they had occupied the entire functional area, leaving no space for other individual workouts. Despite my preference for using the functional area and the available equipment, I was requested to leave the area mid-workout to accommodate the ongoing class. To my surprise, I was even advised to take my 24kg kettlebell upstairs, though I initially presumed it to be a jest.

Considering the gym's size and layout, it would be more appropriate for group classes to take place in the designated class area upstairs rather than overtaking the entire functional area. This way, both group class participants and individual gym-goers can enjoy a more harmonious and conducive workout environment.

I understand that group classes are an integral part of a gym's offerings, but it is equally important to ensure that designated areas are respected to cater to everyone's fitness preferences.

To those who particularly enjoy incorporating exercises involving the sledge, box jumps, kettlebells, pull-up bars, and free weight racks into their routine, I would advise avoiding the gym during the hours of 0600-0700 to prevent any potential disruptions.

As a result of this unfortunate experience, I have decided to discontinue my membership with Pure Gym. I rarely write reviews, but the manner in which I was asked to leave the area was undeniably discourteous and unprofessional.

I hope my feedback can contribute to a more considerate and inclusive gym environment for all members.

text:
The worst PureGym I have ever trained at by far.

Context: I spent a lot of the summer traveling for my work, meaning I would be traveling from gym to gym. I spent 6 weeks in this particular location as the drive to byfleet was a little out the way.

Review:

It was by far the worst PureGym I have been to.

I will give credit where credit is deserved, the location is central and easy to get to, plenty of parking although crossing the bridge in peak times is very annoying. Location is very modern with nice facilities, staff seemed alright although I didn’t speak to any of them, the space itself is big spanning two floors. Changing rooms were nice and tidy, studios and cardio rooms were actually very good.

Where this place lacks is the gym floor.

They use the old style of PureGym layout so not the new rigs and just a lot of it is just a wasted space. The gym gets unbearably busy to the point you’re sharing machines with 4-6 other people and it’s just an awful experience.

I tried playing around with different timings and I could never get there when it was somewhat quiet (ie not having to share equipment at the least.)

This gym has a load of members and the gym just cannot facilitate so many people with a lot of misused space and wasted space. Finding weight plates was a whole another story as it was lacking significantly.

I think this gym has a lot of potential given the location and members and whether they upgrade the facilities is unknown.

Overall I would not recommend as it can be intimidating for new gym goers, and for us frequent goers it’s just not worth the hassle.

Personally I always try to train in independent gyms as and where I can for this reason but unfortunately It just was not for me.

text:
Plenty of equipment across floors but issues with air conditioning, cleanlyness and smell. The second floor (weights floor) has non functional air con, the units are pumping out heat whilst the other floors are properly controlled. When I asked about it I was told the roof air con was broken during the heat wave and that someone was coming out the next day...thats was weeks ago and its been more than a month with broken air con, clearly no urgency with repairs. The cleaning units are either empty or filled up elsewhere in the gym. Some cleaning units only have alcohol hand gel to clean equipment with. There is also a lingering smell in the stairwell to the first and  second floor that I can only describe as mouldy cabbage. The male changing rooms literally smell of toilet. So if you don't mind a gym literally for the equipment and nothing more then it ticks to box.

Update Oct 2022: The smells have gone, thr heat issues remain since the heatwave of this summer but its got worse, 2 out of the 3 sections on the top floor are now too warm leaving obe small area at the back which has a reasonable temperature. text: Loved this gym during all three visits. Great equipment, loads of space, and quite busy for some obvious reasons. Unfortunately, my encounter with one of the PTs ruined it all for me. My friend and I were doing stretches in one of the cardio rooms when we realized the stretching room with mats had been replaced by a free weight room with some benches. We couldn't find mats but spotted two mats with some equipment next to them in the cardio room. After we finished, we didn't realize that those mats did not belong there. We were approached by a staff member who was quite abrupt and told us to put the mats back. We tried to explain that we didn't put them there and that we didn't know where they belonged. He wouldn't listen and kept telling us to do so, becoming more agitated. My friend mentioned that he was rude and that there is a way to tell someone nicely, especially since we had no idea that the mats didn't belong there. text: This is a message I tried to send privately -via email, private message on social media, etc. But you don't make it easy: no contact emails, phones and use chatbots on social media. I had no luck getting to a real person so I'll copy it all here.  Hi, I have been wanting to write for a few weeks now regarding the state of the male showers in some of your gyms. I have been a member for over a decade and used to visit one or more of your gyms in Edinburgh almost daily. To me these were exceptional, well priced and always clean.  Well, after a long break during the pandemic years I have started training again -Mostly in Edinburgh West Gym but also in the one in Dunfermline, and have to say the state of the shower facilities is really something... I have thought many times about taking some photos or a video and posting it all to social media but I don't like to be the creep with a phone out in the changing rooms and prefer to give you the chance to rectify this.   Just to make it clear, the male showers in Edinburgh West are not being properly (or at all?) cleaned -they have orange stains (accumulated dirt) all over the place, shower drains that were partially blocked by fluff and stuff weeks ago still as they were. This is the case no matter what time (early morning, afternoon, late at night) I visit. Every single time I find myself looking for a shower that would not instantly give me some kind of fungal bacteria by merely stepping onto it. Yesterday It was mission impossible... Honestly, most disgusting showers I have ever encounter! It's not dirt of use, it's dirt of not being cleaned.  This was my experience too a few months back in the Dunfermline but admittedly I haven't had to use them as much so cannot confirm if still the case -going there today, so I'll update later.  The changing rooms and the gym floors are nice and clean, this message is only about the state of the showers.  I always recommended Puregym to everybody: great gym network, good atmosphere, excellent pricing and, at the time, superb cleaning. What happened in the last few years?  I cannot be the first writing about this but regardless, I would really appreciate if you forward this message to someone who can act on it ASAP.   Thanks.

If you are a casual gym goer then it’s pretty much perfect - got all the basic equipment, loads of cardio gear, it’s open 24hr. During peak times it gets way too busy to the point it’s not even worth going.

text:
The timing of a class is exactly when people finish work so I made an effort to leave work earlier but was slightly late to the class. The instructor was tight and gave no leeway. Now before anyone mentions the policy about missing warm up. PureGym has that as a failsafe policy for injuries and also not all instructors follow this disciplinarian policy. I ensured the instructor that I had rushed here by bike and I was warmed up. To no avail. Fine, I understand it's their discretion.  The policy could also be a more flexible that informs members that participation is at their own risk. But perhaps the schedule is to blame?

I considered to use the gym anyway but I found no lockers. People leaving their belongings in unlocked lockers is also frustrating, giving a false sense of availability.

text:
I have been a member of a few Pure Gyms in Edinburgh since 2012, so was looking forward to the gym opening in Linlithgow. It opened yesterday (18th August 2023) and I visited this morning. A few issues I have:

* 2 of my previous Pure Gyms in Edinburgh were Craigleith and Gorgie. Both of these gyms are more than twice the size of Linlithgow Pure Gym. Gorgie is £22.99 per month and Craigleith is £25.99 per month, Core. Linlithgow will be £25.99 per month Core, after the 6 month promo of £14.99. This is far too expensive for this size of gym in Linlithgow and the surrounding areas. The new Pure Gym opening in Falkirk in September 2023, will be £10.99 for the first 10 months and then £20.99 after that. This will also be a larger gym.
£18.99 after the initial 6 months, would be a much more reasonable price for Linlithgow.
* Whoever had the bright idea of facing all 6 treadmills towards a large white wall in a dark corner of the gym, has obviously never set foot on a treadmill! No one wants to run or walk on a treadmill and have to stare at a wall. Please either add mirrors all along the wall to give the Illusion of looking out, whilst also being able to see into the gym behind you. Or turn the treadmills around to face into the gym!
* You have known this gym was opening for quite some time and yet, there were no materials to clean or wipe down the equipment after use. We've only just come out of a pandemic. No one wants to have to use a piece of equipment that's covered in someone else's sweat!
* The gym was boiling. I'd rather it was warm than too cold, but either some air con or fans would be a very good idea, unless you want people passing out!
* Not enough weight benches. 3 weight benches for a gym is nowhere near enough. This is a small gym, so I imagine on a Monday evening, there will be a lot of people standing around, waiting to use equipment.

All of the above is very disappointing, especially given the amount of time that you've known this gym was opening and the amount of time we've all had to wait for it to open. Please can you sort all of the above out immediately. These are all issues which can be easily rectified.

If there have been no changes soon, then I definitely won't be returning and I know I won't be the only one!

text:
This place has gone down hill. Maybe a change in management is needed.

The gym is packed solid between 4pm-8pm and it is impossible for find any free space to exercise, let alone access any of the machines, squat racks, studio etc. Basically, if you want to use a machine or bench, then join the queue! People are left to using the prowler/sledge area as this is only bit of space free sometimes so it means no one can use the prowler/sledge. The gym is clearly over-sold hoping people will join and not attend!

Cheap Matrix brand of low quality equipement, often broken and not fixed, for example the vibrating power plate, which was broken for months, never fixed and now disappeared, so if you were a fan of using that then tough luck. The incremental weights for the machines (2.5/5 lbs) have mostly disappeaared which is really unhelpful if you want to do progressive overload. Basic equipment such as skipping rope, resistance bands not present.....why?

The PTs are only interested in talking to you if they think they can get you to buy their overpriced training sessions or if you're a girl (you know what I'm talking about!). Some of the previous staff used to correct people if they were passing by and saw someone using wrong form/had set up machine incorrectly, but those staff have left and as I said the current crop will only talk to you if they can make some money from you (wink wink) or if you're a girl (wink wink).

No hot water for showers quite a few times in the last 12 months, sometimes for days on end. The showers are either cold or scalding and have not been fixed for months.

Spoken to manager about some of these issues eg equipment, showers and issues still not resolved. Now given up.

Another different brand gym has opened with similar pricing, more and better brand new equipment, sauna, women's area and free parking, please consider that one if you can. Even some of the Puregym PTs have left and gone there 😁🤣.

text: Where do I start…. I have been a member of this gym for  a number of years now and I have seen a huge decline with how the gym is run and managed. The gym facilities, air conditioning, equipment and parking  has hit it’s all time lowest point and it appears to me that  this gym is being run into the ground.  The only good thing about the gym is the space to train but there are now so many problems which have not been fixed or dealt with over the years that the issues can not be overlooked anymore.  When speaking to management about the issues it’s never ending excuses with issues not being fixed or dealt with properly.  It’s only going to get worse which is completely unacceptable with the amount of money they are making from memberships each month. Despite the issues and members complaints they actually had the audacity to increase the gym membership 4 months to ago to help “towards the gym maintenance”, no improvements have been made in this time and it’s got significantly worse.  Below is a small snapshot of the issues  ..   •The Air conditioning in the gym has AGAIN stopped working as soon as the hot weather arrives, this is the third year in a row this has happened. The mangers that have come and gone in this time all make the same excuses and say they are working on it and Air conditioning unit uses a smart system which isn't so smart! Its unbearable to train with the heat, not pleasant breathing in everyone’s germs and body odours, sweating like your in a sauna and generally not a nice environment to be in. I felt like I was going to pass out the other day, at least last year they left all the doors open and they hired large portable Aircon units. I’ve had to start training at other gyms because of  this which I shouldn’t have to do when I’m paying for this membership.  • The gym equipment is now old and tired and needs replacing ( like the new Precor equipment they have down south) Things are always broken with out of order signs on, most of  the cable machines are tired  and on there way out, dumbbells and Olympic bars are mostly bent, some cardio machines are broken and need serious maintenance. A serious injury will occur, it’s just waiting to happen!  •Cleaning facilities to wipe equipment down has been reduced  since January therefore equipment is not as clean as it should be. It might be the time of day I train but I personally have never seen a member of staff cleaning the equipment and also changing rooms have a disgusting smell constantly. •The gym did not notify members that 3 months ago there would be building work commencing in the apartments across the road and that the building company would be using upto 20 car park spaces and their builders allowed to park in it too. Parking is difficult for members best of times and not enough spaces for the gym capacity before this. Parking is at a premium and you cannot park in any of the surrounding streets as they are all double yellow lines. We don’t know when it will finish. On many occasions I and other members have had to train at other gyms when it is busy after 5pm because we can’t find a parking space.  •Most  of the PT’s are  unfriendly and not welcoming unless you’re part of their “clique” •The new assistant manager needs to address the issues raised by not only myself, but many other members too instead of parading around the gym gawping at myself and other male members.  I find it really uncomfortable and actually hypocritical given they promote “a no harassment”  campaign on posters all over the gym. Check the CCTV, you can clearly see him checking individuals out.  •The gym is listed on a gay dating/meet up site which members can use the facilities late at night to get up to alsorts. Its been highly rated aswell believe it or not.. Madness! It’s not what we signed up to.  The list is endless and no matter which Manager takes over or managers from head office, none appear to be doing anything about it. Unless something changes drastically, which I don’t think it will, there will be a mass exodus where members will leave and not come back. You shouldn’t be charged nearly £30 a month to be train in substandard facilities where management don’t listen to or address any issues raised.  If you are thinking of joining this gym, do yourself a favour and find another one.

text:
I booked a stretch class for 1530 on September 20th; I was the only person who reserved this session. The instructor approached me and informed me that the class would not be held because I was the only person registered, and that we would have to wait and see if anyone else joined. I asked the instructor why I hadn't been informed earlier, and I was told that we don't notify people or cancel classes, and I was advised to check the app to see how many people had booked before attending the class, which surprised me two reasons: 1) it is not my responsibility or headache to know how many people have booked because I am a paying customer. 2) It appears that you have a stringent guideline stating that a class should only be cancelled four hours in advance; therefore, even if I notice that no one has booked the class two hours prior, I still cannot cancel it.

Even though I was given the option of a 1:1 session,  it should have been anyways offered without requiring me to wait or cancel the class or may be even have this conversation. Perhaps it was offered since the instructor noticed my wet brolly while it was raining heavily outside and that I informed that I have joined this class during my office lunch hour. I realise it has nothing to do with the instructor; they are simply carrying out their duties, but Pure Gym needs to do a better job of alerting clients when there is only one person signed up for a session or cancel the class themseles 4 hours prior and notify the attendee that this class cannot take place.  At the very least, I would not have squandered my time, energy, and money. It's particularly detrimental for new consumers when you've recently renovated the gym!  I will most certainly not recommend my friends who were supposed to take a membership with Pure Gym London Finchley.

text: Thank you for your feedback regarding the air conditioning in the gym.   We have recently made slight changes to this area, looking at improving energy efficiency. This is both to control our energy usage, but also with a look to reduce our carbon footprint. By law, we have a requirement to provide a certain amount of fresh air based on occupancy levels, and our ventilation system increases and decreases at different times throughout the day and night, making sure we meet these requirements and provide good air movement around the gyms. These levels are based on size of the gym, and occupancy levels, and are regularly monitored.   With regards to the temperature in the gym, we use air conditioning units which heat the air when it drops below 17.5C, and cools the air when it goes higher than 21.5C, keeping the temperature within the gym at an acceptable level. This is regularly checked to ensure the units are operating as they should be across all of our gyms.   On occasion, we can get faults on our ventilation and AC systems which is normal. When this happens, there is a process in place to ensure we arrange for our contractors to attend, investigate and resolve the faults and return the systems back to full working order within a timely manner.   All member feedback is reviewed, and brought to the attention of our Facilities team, who regularly review any changes we make to our gym facilities and all feedback is taken into account when making any future changes.   We hope you continue to enjoy the gym in the meantime!     We'd love to take some feedback on the service provided today. Please click here to complete a 1-minute survey!  Thanks,  Clare   PureGym Member Services

text: PureGym’s class cancellation policy (cancel up to 4 hours before the class starts, 3 late cancellations within a month and you lose the right to book classes) is ableist and inaccessible. Ironic as marketing is always putting out ‘be your authentic self’ and ‘our gyms are for everyone’ messages.   Some disabilities, parental and carer responsibilities, mental health conditions - and just if you had booked an early morning class and woke up feeling ill - are all reasons why the 4 hour window is too large and disproportionately affects groups that already face challenges.   Speaking from a place of lived experience, I don’t think PureGym is as inclusive as it brands itself as and I’d encourage it to look at its cancellation policy with someone who can advise on diversity, inclusion and equity.   PureGym: you’re alienating a very large proportion of your customers and it adds insult to injury that your marketing messages don’t align. Do better.

text: I've been a member of this gym for about  2 years and I've noticed that the hygiene and cleanliness standards for the men's changing room have deteriorated somewhat, particularly the showers that have a dreadful stench to them. It regularly stinks of weed in the changing rooms and in the stairwell.   Furthermore I've noticed that there's a lot of chopping and changing of classes, primarily due to the high churn of PT staff. text:
Gym looks nice and was actually a good place to work out until a few weeks ago when upper management within the company decided to get greedy and put out yet another out offer to attract more members, despite the gym being very evidenty at capacity.

It’s now impossible to get a good workout in due to lack of available equipment, even during off-peak hours. Even when it isn’t overcrowded, there aren’t enough plates for the leg press machine.

Others have also mentioned that it’s too warm. It is. I’ve seen the company respond to this saying t they use an automatic temperature regulation system. The system isn’t broken, you’re just setting it too high in all of your gyms to save on costs.

None of these issues are related to the staff in this gym specifically. I have been to at least 6-7 Pure Gym locations and the issues I’ve mentioned are a problem in almost every single one.

The issue is greed of upper management trying to cram as many people as possible into their locations despite it ruining the experience, and skimping on air conditioning. You can still be profitable without ruining the experience, raise the price if you need to.

text: Walked 3 miles to use the gym this morning.  On arrival a sign on the entrance said that the ladies' changing rooms were closed. So, after being in the gym for 5 minutes and unable to find any management apart from a bloke who was reparing the floor, I scanned out and walked 3 miles home.  If you want a bargain-basement gym experience join here.  If you need a changing room and working showers look elsewhere.
