The trainer justified this by saying I missed the warm-up but the class itself was packed to the brim and if you read the other low rating reviews you can easily see they are not managing bookings properly so let’s be honest here about what the issue is. Any respectable venue would check names before allowing attendees in the class and would give a 5 minutes grace for entrance. Back to Nuffield I go.

Other complaints are:
Equipment being broken fairly frequently and taking a while to fix
Venue smelling bad generally - makes you wonder about hygiene standards
Severe overcrowding at peak times - I understand it’s a budget gym and I guess this comes with the territory (and it’s indeed why I decided to try out a class this time around because it’d be a challenge to secure a squat rack at this time - 6.30pm on a Wednesday)

This review pertains to the Legs, Abs & Tums class of Wednesday 22nd November 6.30pm. Toodles!

P.S. I’d appreciate it if the venue didn’t respond to tell me how “popular” Pure Gyms venues are as it did to the other low rating reviews. It’s a budget gym that allows oversubscription and has poor booking management, not the most popular girl in class. Be so for real. Cute public perception management attempt, I suppose.

text: Pure Gym Lewisham, has its ups and downs, mostly down! I have been a member at this gym for a while. It was much better when it was run by Fitness First, but then Pure Gym took it over. Since then things just seem to go from bad to worse. If it wasn't for the personal trainers who are friendly and professional I would have left this gym a long time ago. The men's changing room and toilets tend to have an awful smell with leaks in the toilets on a regular basis. The hot water, as another member had pointed out, had been out of service for months. Last year the bench in the changing room was not fixed down properly causing me injury and now just a few days ago my locker was broken into. All of my belongings were tipped out in the locker but nothing appeared to be missing, until I went shopping and noticed the cash I had in my wallet was gone. My cards were all still there but as a precaution I cancelled them just in case they had been skimmed. I reported it to staff who seemed to play it down and that a locker theft was rare and that it was the fault of a poor quality padlock. My padlock is of excellent quality!  I went to the police and reported the theft. The police said there wasn't much they could do but did state that thefts from this gym was quite regular and they have had a lot of members complaining to them. They said that Pure Gym needs to enforce their security but don't. When I went back in to the gym the next day I had to ask for a locker theft form, which I then completed. I was a bit surprised that this was not offered to me when I reported the theft to the staff that day. Another member of staff then heard me talking about the break in and said not another one!  Personally I don't think Pure Gym care as long as members keep paying membership. I now need to seriously think of finding another gym. Just because this gym is convenient and close to my home is no longer a good excuse the remain a member here.

text: I was at Puregym (London wall site) on the morning of 9th Aug 2023 and after 2hrs of working out I decided to cool down on the treadmill just doing a brisk walk.   One of the PG staff team who claim she is the manager, walked up to me  and said i must put my bag away because it was health & safety.  I said to her, I have been here for 2hrs now, so I am just cooling down for 10mins and I am done, before I knew what was happening I went back on the treadmill,  the staff  member said to me again, can you put your bag away now!   I again explained to her, I heard you, and I am aware of what you are asking, but I only need 10mins on the treadmill and I am done.  She interrupted me again and was quite aggressive and insisting I put my bag away IMMEDIATELY!!!  I got off the treadmill and said to her, my bag is not obstructing anyone and is practically nothing inside, the staff member got very defensive and said I was rude to her, I asked her, how am I being rude to you? she said I was frowning at her!!! Next thing I knew what was happening she said something else (couldn't hear her due to the loud music) and then she stomped off.   I just want to make this clear I am aware of the no bags on gym floor policies, but I merely forgot to lock it away this morning and bought my bag on the gym floor.  The staff member stated she is the Manager, I am actually shocked to hear she is the manager and spoke to the members in that tone   I felt it was not what she said to me, but HOW she spoke to me, if she is the Manager she should know very well as “good customer services” you don’t talk to your members like this, in fact you don't talk to anyone like this, I felt she spoke to me as if I was a stupid child in a playground! I am 51 years of age and I am aware of Health & Safety, I work for the NHS as a Business manager so I appreciate she does not talk to the members as if they are some silly naughty child in a school classroom, does she speaks to her staff like that? She sounded like if I did not do it STRAIGHT AWAY as I am told, or I will get a slap!!!    What I am trying to said is, you will get members not always going to focus on the health & Safety i.e. putting weights back or not to take bags or belongings onto gym floor,  we all have busy life and not always aware of what we are doing, we just want to come to the gym do our training and leave. She could have just give me a little reminder and left it at that, and if I did this again, Yes of course I agree there will be a warning, however DON’T talk to me as if I am a stupid naughty child in a classroom, I did not appreciate it and I am sure no one want to be spoken to the way she did.    And for her to get defensive saying I was rude by frowning at her is just for her to attack me first, because she wanted the last words.  I joined the whole of PGs (£54 a month) to use All the UK PG over a month ago so I can have the options to use other sites too, I do not pay this much to have some silly staff talk to me like I am stupid, frankly I felt harass and provoke by her, and PG is supposed to put a stop to harassment, THIS IS A JOKE! PUREGYM PROMOTE HARRASSMENT NOT PREVENTING IT"! Puregym London Wall deserve "0" star, i only use London wall site it 2 - 3 times a week because i work in the CITY! i go to other sites ( Greenwich, kidbrooke, Beckton etc and i never had any issues) this has left me feeling very vulnerable and quite anxious and at the same time i felt harass by her, but i am not going to allow this person make me feel harass or ruin my day.

text:
NOT ENOUGH KIT Very basic gym. Worst Puregym in Stockport it has less equipment that Stockport south, Denton & Debdale, yet is more expensive? Many people have noted that this gym can get busy, another way of looking at it is there isn't enough equipment, despite there being space for more and other layout options. I have been in at 9pm ish on a Sunday night,15 people in the free weight section, 10 people in the fixed resistance machines area and 2 people on cardio kit. NOONE was in the functional or stretch areas! You have the ratio wrong! I've been in many times and encountered similar patterns of use.

Because you only have one of each machine even if there are few people in the gym you end up waiting to use stuff. Or if a machine is broken you have no alternative. Matrix makes several iterations of their machines it would be nice if you could provide them. the chest press you have only provides a pronated grip. Matrix make a chest press that has both pronated and neutral (Aura ChestPress G3-S10) this machine also follows a more similar pattern to the bench press as it has more of a J- curve to it.  they have a different version of the row (Aura SeatedRow G3-S31). It would be great to have a seated leg curl as studies show they are better for hypertrophy. Additionally pregnant women are not supposed to exercise in prone (bending forward) so really they shouldn't use the lying one. Overweight people and those with mobility difficulties ,might also find the seated version more suitable!

Both the leg presses you have are rubbish, which leaves me with no secondary squat movement (aggravating). I have used the matrix hack squat before  (its not great) (I've used precor, cybex and hammer strength) but would take the matrix hack as a last resort. I have seen Matrix do something called a perfect squat. How about some Precor kit, puregym have service contracts with them.

Please get more equipment in the stretch area or move cardio kit there and expand the fix weight section towards the entrance, this could allow for a MINIMUM 4 more machines. You don't need to be asinine regarding carpet for fixed weights & cardio, its fine to just move the kit. The rack with kettlebells on could be moved, opening up the resistance section for AT LEAST 3 more machines. It wouldn't hurt to have some heavier Kettlebells.

this gym should be on  2 levels. If you had of built a mezzanine level you could have had a Mecca of a gym. The kit possibilities would have been great. It  is too late now and would cause disruption to do this. However I think you should have a mezzanine over the stretch area as that would create more floor space with minimal disruption. It seems to me puregym lack ambition, but I guess that's obvious as they use bottom of the barrel matrix machines.There was a cleaning station in the free weight area, when this was removed I was hoping it would be replaced with a machine but nothing has been added? You saw it fit to have a big cleaning station so I can't accept any arguments about restricted space as you had something there!

I have tried early morning 5am ish but both squat racks were in use and I'm not happy using the blkbox racks as there are no safety arms. Your advice to members complaining its too busy is to try quieter times but that is not always possible due to work, family etc and as demonstrated I couldn't do my workout at 5am due to lack of kit! Spotter arms would allow exercises like pin presses in addition to the added safety which is important as members may sometimes be training alone!

Just because you are busy doesn't mean your doing a good job, I train here and hate it but its in a convenient location for me so I keep coming. I'm really not asking for much. It's embarrassing that there are INDEPENDENT gyms like ep iron jungle in bredbury, grandnasium & x fitenss in hazel grove that are better that a multinational gym chain with tons of cash like puregym. Unfortunately for me they are not easy for me to always get to regularly which I why I have to SETTLE  for DEPRESSING puregym.

text: Such a shame to have to write the review because I’ve always liked this gym. Was going before covid and never had any issues with the parking. Until returning again this year in September 2023, unaware of the new parking regulations. They’ve now teamed up with Smart Parking LTD who have no customer service at all and don’t care what your reasons are regarding parking fines from said car park. The gym do absolutely nothing to make people aware of this apart from a silly sign when you first walk in, after scanning the QR code ,telling you to enter your reg (not in big enough writing) on a tablet stuck to the wall, not even in plain sight.. Also noting that before you enter via the automatic turnstiles, there’s a massive sign that says they will not discuss parking fine issues on site. So they know this is a problem.. yet they don’t do anything more to make people more aware of their parking rules. Considering every time I went during Sep-nov 2023, 9/10 there was someone standing at a small desk or hovering around the entrance, so they could have kindly reminded people that if they have parked, to put their car reg in, but no, that would be too easy. Currently can’t afford the membership anymore as I’m now paying off hundreds of pounds worth of fines because Smart Parking LTD decided they wanted to take a whole month to send me the first of many fines. Don’t pick this gym unless you have spare money to waste on parking fines.

text:
I am writing after nearly three taxing years of membership at your Greenwich-based PureGym establishment, during which I've patiently stooped to an increasingly appalling set of conditions, with visits averaging 3-4 times per week.

To say your establishment has gone downhill within the year is like saying the Titanic had a minor leak. The standard of upkeep is pitiful, with cracked walls, constant leaks, broken water fountains, and an overall deplorable level of hygiene that beggars belief, especially in the shower facilities. Cold water and mould appear to be the accepting norms, rather than the exception, with half the showers out of service at any one time.

Despite the cheap membership fee, currently standing at £25.99 but soon to add insult to injury with an increase to £27.99, one always hopes for a basic level of service and cleanliness. Bitterly, I find the current standards to be deeply disappointing and frankly always a hindrance to my exercise regime.

In the simplest of terms, I wouldn't recommend this gym to my worst enemy. The only reason I continue is due to lack of options.

For the sake of absolute clarity - I'm not penning this diatribe for my own amusement or benefit. I'm doing it for the sake of all members who deserve better.

text: The gym itself I can't fault. Very clean, to a good standard and well maintained.  However, take caution if you are considering hiring one of the PT's there (I won't say who, due to it being there being an ongoing investigation regarding this PT).   The PT I hired promised, for £233 a month, 8 sessions and a fitness plan I could follow. However, this was not delivered. The in-person sessions completely contradicted the online sessions set, the diet plan was completely off from what I needed, the supplements didn't match to watch I stipulated (I told the PT I couldn't take creatine, yet the diet plan heavily relied on it) and I ended up with several injuries as a result of the exercises set-The reason I hired a PT was so I could recover from injuries, among other things.  The PT only delivered on 4 booked sessions, of the 8 promised. I met them for a 5th, however I won't count that one, he cancelled the booked one at short notice, and rearranged it for a time that was completely unsuitable. Even though I attended, I only completed about half of it because I ended up with an injury, because he booked a running session the day after another running session, as the PT hadn't checked the online sessions he had set for me. I ended up not being able to rest my legs.  I didn't hear anything after that from the PT for over a week. I was surprised to find the PT had charged me for another month, with no direct debit set up, no subscription agreement set up, nor had the PT asked whether I wanted another month. The PT hadn't delivered on one month's worth of sessions.  We're now nearly 3 weeks since I had the money taken out, and the PT has STILL to book a session or even contact me. The clearly never intended on delivering a session this month.  I've tried contacting Puregym, and making them aware of the situation. The PT is still operating at the Gym, and the issue is still not resolved. I haven't really heard from anyone, beyond the odd email to state they were aware. I'm not the sort to publicly shame, and I was prepared to give the gym time to resolve this issue. However, as I haven't heard anything, I don't have much of a choice.
